comments:
Subject : hu : Second line is truncated in Log View panel
Testcase/Filename : 27.00132
Category : : TVT/Testing

Priority 1

OS : RHEL 3.1
Must fix or not a must fix: YES
Build date:23/05
Component name:TPTP
Blocking: NO
Language: hu
Bitmap Location: Not available
Tester Name: Gabor Kiss
Problem Description:
Add button is not working in comments section

Stpes:

Start the workbench and from the workbench main menu
Window->Preferences
File->New->Other
Expand Profiling and Logging
Select Symptom database
Click Next
Drop down the Format box (Verify ?Symptom 0.1? is translated)
Click Browse
Select an existing project (for ex. ?LogAnalyzerProject)
Click Ok (Make sure a folder name is filled in the ?Folder? text box.)
Type in ?TVTSymtptom2DB? in the ?Name? text box
Make sure ?Symptom 2.0? is selected in the format combo box and that ?Open editor after creation? is checked.
Click Finish
Switch to the Details tab
Select the root node ((the Symptom catalog)) in the left hand side tree of the editor
Expand the comments section
Click Add button in the Comments section

Same for Korean

Same applies for the Greek version.

thx
Peppy

Same for Italian build...
Thx

and for Finnish...

This article was reassigned from Category:''TVT/Testing''.

Same problem for Portuguese PTG - the Add comment window we are supposed to get by clicking "Add" does not appear, making it impossible to add a new comment to the Symptom Catalogue.
This problem is blocking the completion of the testcase.

Please refer to screenshot for details.

W:\defects\pt\TCT#655

Same problem to Brazilian Portuguese.

Tks

George

Created an attachment (id=42437)
TCT#655.jpg

People that have encountered the "Add comments" problems, could you please attach the eclipse .log file, so that I can take a look.
Thanks.

Are this comments generated by a tool ? If not can you please try to be a little more descriptive so that the development team can be more productive in identifying the problem and fixing it. 
The only comment that makes sense and helped us identify the issue is #7, which was actually provided by the development team
The development team would appreciate if you can use the same pattern.

What we are looking for when investigating a problem is
- clear description of the issue
- any exceptions generated at the console or .metadata\.log
- screen captures
